Now suppose B’ = {v1, v2,…, vk} consists of k linearly independent vectors in V, with k < n. Then B’ is a basis for a proper k-dimensional subspace of V (but not V itself) and C = [v1 v2…vk] is a rectangular non-invertible n x k matrix.
